title: Why README and examples still dont use the python 3.5 `async def` style?
clean_text: like some exampl use style readm refactor exampl refactor

title: Why README and examples still dont use the python 3.5 `async def` style?

text:
Hi, @pahaz 
It does not make much sense to change `@coroutine & yield from` to `async def & await` in readme.
`aioredis` support python3.3/3.4+ which has no native coroutine so, I guess, using `@coroutine` and `yield from`s is more verbose regarding support of those python versions.
clean_text: Hi pahaz It make much sens chang readm support python3334 nativ coroutin I guess use verbos regard support python version

text: Many other `aio-libs` use new style. I think that new still is more preferable in examples. (my opinion)
clean_text: mani use new style I think new still prefer exampl opinion
